channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrown Weeds, 4th July
item.description:
Weeds growing on the pavement areas within Sandstar Close. The issue is both sides of the close where boundaries meet the pavements. Its a small road with a cul de sac at the end so it's from 22-16 but on the odd side as well.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandstar Close, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary road sign is blocking driver view when turning out of junction, 4th July
item.description:
As you try to turn out onto the main road coming from Upper Dowdeswell, there is a temporary road sign placed on the verge on the right hand side. This is completely blocking the driver view when looking right so you cannot see fast moving traffic. It is dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Overgrown brambles crossing walkway, 4th July
item.description:
The whole pathway from Longlevens to barnwood link road is overgrown and cyclists are having to cut across pedestrians and vice versa to avoid the brambles
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: As you leave the Tesco car park the roundabout is very very faded, 4th July
item.description:
As you leave Tesco car park into Colletts Drive the roundabout white is faded completely
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Colletts Drive, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham

item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Double yellows faded, 4th July
item.description:
Which may be why nobody pays attention to them. Please could these be repainted; if there are any bollards which can be put up to stop people parking here even better.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 275, Old Bath Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Terrible fdrainage, 4th July
item.description:
Bypass drainage is terrible and historically a flood risk. New building works has removed all natural flood management. No improvements made at flood risk spot at lowest point of the bypass. Current road works look to make issue worse due due to limited drains/no improvements. Will cause further issues unless there is plan in place to fix this, which there is no indication of.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Valiant Way, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Half of Leckhampton Lane resurfaced around 3 years ago (other half should have been also but was not). The half of road that was not resurfaced is full of big cracks and potholes., 3rd July
item.description:
From just beyond the turn off at Meadowsweet Road heading down Leckhampton Lane towards Shurdington Road until the circa 2022 resurfacing. The worst part is near where the resurfaced part takes over (huge cracks). Resurfaced part is OK but the remainder of the road needs complete resurfacing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
